payload.name: evidential-dempster-shafer
payload.core: Allocate probability mass to sets of possibilities rather than single hypotheses. Combine evidence via Dempster's rule into belief (minimum support) and plausibility (maximum support) intervals, explicitly representing ignorance.

out.d: allocation of evidence to focal elements

proc: define frame: enumerate mutually exclusive hypotheses
assign mass: allocate evidence weights to focal sets
compute belief: sum mass of all subsets for each hypothesis
compute plausibility: 1 minus belief in complement
combine sources: apply Dempster's rule if independent
interpret intervals: [Bel, Pl] bounds true probability
check: frame is exhaustive and mutually exclusive

diff.bayesian: mass on sets vs point probabilities; explicit ignorance vs prior selection
diff.fuzzy-logic: uncertainty about membership vs vagueness of concept boundaries

signals: mass on empty set before normalization

ex.sit: Two sensors assess object type: {car, truck, bus}. Sensor A: 0.6 to {car}, 0.4 to {car,truck}. Sensor B: 0.7 to {car,bus}, 0.3 to frame.
steps: combine via Dempster: compute intersections, normalize
ex.insight: evidence converges on car despite different focal elements; ignorance reduced through fusion
